717558f-a.text:
1641-1649 Broadway, at the S.W. corner of West 51st Street, showing a 6-story structure at this location housing the Capitol Theatre which at this date has hot opened. The low building on the left is at the
N.W. corner of 50th Street.
About 1920.

717565f-a.text:
The Hotel Albany, now an apartment house, Broadway, west side, from 51st to 52nd Streets. This will be torn down in 1928 to make way for the Hollywood Theatre and the Broadway Block Building.
About 1921.
Wurts Brothers.

730318f-a.title: General view - Broadway - Northwest.
730318f-a.text:
A general view, northwest from the Capitol Theatre (Moving Picture
House) at 51st Street and Broadway.
October 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

730319f-a.title: General view - Broadway - North.
730319f-a.text:
A general view, north from the Capitol Theatre (Moving Picture House) at 51st Street and Broadway, showing the upper stories of the Park Central
Hotel (55th Street and Seventh Ave).
October 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

717561f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, from 51st to 52nd Streets, seen across the site of the Hotel Albany. In the centre, 1662-1666 Broadway, is the Warner Theatre. The Manhattan Storage and Warehouse Company Building on Seventh Avenue, is in the background, and will still stand in 1934.
October 29, 1928.  4,'g
P. L. Sperr.

717564f-b.text:
(1)
Clearing and excavation on the site of the Hotel Albany, Broadway, west side, from 51st to 52nd Streets.
October 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The Broadway Block Building and the entrance to the Hollywood
Theatre, on the site of the Hotel Albany.
October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

The Hotel Albany shortly before its demolition, Broadway, west
side, from 3lst to 52nd Streets.
February 5, 1928.

717559f-a.text:
The entrance of the Capitol Theatre, Broadway at the S.W.
corner of 51st Street.
July 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

717563f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from, but not including, 51st
Street.
February 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

717562f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from West 5lst and across 52nd to 53rd Streets, showing prominently the New Yorker Theatre occupying a site slightly south of West 52nd Street and bearing No. 1664 Broadway. This is a set of two views, consisting of a negative and a positive.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

717562f-b.text:
Broadway, east side, north from West 5lst and across 52nd to 53rd Streets, showing prominently the New Yorker Theatre occupying a site slightly south of West 52nd Street and bearing No. 1664 Broadway. This is a set of two views, consisting of a negative and a positive.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

1509115-a.title: Broadway - 51st Street - 52nd Street, west side
1509115-a.folder: Broadway - 51st Street - 52nd Street, west side, Manhattan, NY

717569f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, from 52nd to 51st Streets, showing the
demolition of the Hotel Albany.
August 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
